## Energy Data Alert!

#### [Marc Vermette](https://ca.linkedin.com/in/marc-vermette)


The [Canadian Centre for Energy Information (CCEI)](https://energy-information.canada.ca/en), by [Statistics Canada](https://www.statcan.gc.ca/en/about/statcan?MM=1), has undergone a recent update to its [Energy and the Environment (E&E)](https://energy-information.canada.ca/en/subjects/energy-and-environment) section.

This update enhances the already extensive portal that allows users to browse 750+ resources on many energy and environment topics.

The new E&E section features [environmental indicators](https://energy-information.canada.ca/en/indicators), [numerous publications](https://energy-information.canada.ca/en/subjects/energy-and-environment?utm_source=stakeholders&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=statcan_ccei-ccie_2022&utm_content=2022-06-13#pubs-panel) and [data sets](https://energy-information.canada.ca/en/subjects/energy-and-environment?utm_source=stakeholders&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=statcan_ccei-ccie_2022&utm_content=2022-06-13#datasets-panel), and includes information on each data set.

The [interactive charts and tables](https://energy-information.canada.ca/en/subjects/energy-and-environment?utm_source=stakeholders&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=statcan_ccei-ccie_2022&utm_content=2022-06-13#tab-overview) allow users to visualise the data on demand.
